question.text: Which of the following is incorrect about the excretory system of human?

options.text: About 10 million nephrons are found in each kidney.
The right kidney is located lower than that of the left kidney.
Ultrafiltration occurs at the level of Bowman's capsule.
Longer the loop of Henle more will be the concentration of urine.

solution.text: About 1 million nephrons are found in each kidney in the human body. The right kidney is located about 2.5 cm lower than that of the left kidney as the liver is present on the right side just below the diaphragm. Bowman's capsule is the only site for ultrafiltration. Length of the loop of Henle is directly proportional to the concentration of urine.
